name: places/ChIJubXl779YwokRox1olaeddf8
adrFormatAddress: 1219A 3rd Ave, New York, NY 10021-2938, USA

originalText.text: The service I received from the nail tech was great. I got a gel manicure. However, my nail came off after a couple of days so I returned to get my nail fixed. My nail tech was not present. The manager, I am assuming, a taller asian woman, looked at my nails, and told me to find the color. I could not remember which color I chose. Then, she proceeded to tell me that I did not get my nails done there because they did not have the color. I showed her the original picture, where the color looked a little lighter. She requested to see my receipt. I saw the way she treated the white clients. So, I already decided I did not want her to service me any further. Id rather take my business elsewhere. Finally, I retrieved the receipt. I showed her. She looked and said, "oh". She offered no apology, no nail fix or anything. Her customer service was very poor when it came to me. I am highly disappointed and based off of her lack of professionalism I will never return to that location or refer anyone there. Prior to this I spoke highly of this place.

originalText.text: They are scammers. They sat us (my mom and I) down for pedicure and manicure. When another client came in, they said… now I have to go as they have an appointment. Both me and my mom had to leave as nobody was available for the services. Not sure they they sat us down for both services if they did not have availability. Wasted my time and now I have left without the manicure. Then I said take $10 tip each so $20 total. They swiped my card for $40. $40 tip for a pedicure? Please!!!! Scammmers …. Do not go here. There are many other places nearby.

originalText.text:
I walked in and asked for a pedicure. Sat down said I just wanted the normal pedicure not the spa one. The girl nodded. The service menu was not discussed any further than that. When I came to pay the girl had done a spa pedicure. Twice the price!
The woman at the till said that the girl had explained the menu to me - she had not. The woman at the till then said that she had seen her do so! Which she did not, so now I am essentially being called a liar. I wasn’t rude to her or angry, she could have just apologised that the spa menu was not explained, and my initial request for a normal pedicure was not heard or not understood, instead she was rude to me. I won’t be going back here for this reason, which is a shame as the pedicure was good.

originalText.text: The manager is rude and disrespectful and racist. I went to this salon to ask how much they charge to have my gel powder and acrylic tips removed the manager told me $15 so i said ok thats fine. In the process of them removing my nails the lady by the name Anna began removing my nails with a METRO CARD ! Then both the manager and anna started filing the acrylics off my nail instead of soaking them off in acetone. My end result was extremely thin nails acrylic still on my nails and my nails hurt so much and are so red because of how they filed my nails with the machine to then be charged $26. I asked the manager how my price went from $15 to $26 dollars and her response was it took more than an hour and that this is not the bronx. Save your money and do not go here ladies.

originalText.text: I walked in thinking I had an appointment to this place, but it ended up being another salon. They didn’t even confirm if my appointment was at this salon, but told me to pick a color for the pedicure I was planning to get. Before I sat down, I asked how much the pedicure would be. $37... Ok, it’s the Upper Eastside, I think. Maybe it’s excellent service and I won’t regret trying somewhere new (it’s right by my job). Wrong. My service was completely rushed, and the person doing the service was extremely aggressive with moving my legs around and tapping where she wanted me to put my feet. It made me feel so unwanted. When my color was put on my nails, it was kind of clear since it was a white color. I asked for a third coat and she made several comments about how my nails were bumpy and that’s why the color looks like that. That really bothered me because it was clear that the nail wasn’t the cause of the transparent nail polish. She repeated SEVERAL times that I had a bumpy nails which was so rude and absolutely unnecessary. Then she told me that some ladies have long narrow toenails, but mine were short and wide. Again, rude. Then she tried to blame the poor job on the nail color. If she knew that nail polish was crumby, why would she let me continue with that color? Icing on the cake was when I was drying my nails, they had air bubbles. I tried to fix them myself since she did not check on me at all, only then she ran over and put on another coat. I gave her a $5 tip, even though I wanted to give her $3 to make it an even $40, and she did not even say thank you. I will never return to this place and I strongly advise against visiting this nail salon.
